main event: A bright white light was sighted over Ernest Harmon AFB in Newfoundland, Canada that gradually increased in size, split into two, and then broke up into five fast-moving and high-altitude objects.
interesting points: The object was initially a bright white light that gradually increased in size.
The object split into two and then broke up into five fast-moving and high-altitude objects.
The objects were circular in shape, reddish in color, and appeared to be metallic, reflecting light.
The objects made a vertical climb out of sight after being observed for an additional period of time.
The observers were a major, his wife, and an airman who were in the housing area at Ernest Harmon AFB.
sighted object: bright white light that grew in size and split into multiple fast-moving reddish metallic objects
witnesses: a major, his wife, and an airman
